data.title: Nvidia replaces Intel on the Dow Jones Industrial Average
data.text: Nvidia (NVDA) is set to replace Intel (INTC) on the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) on Friday. Intel has been a fixture in the benchmark index since 1999, but its shares have plummeted nearly 48% throughout 2024.

data.title: Nvidia and the history of Big Tech on the Dow
data.text: Chipmaker Nvidia (NVDA) and paint company Sherwin-Williams (SHW) have joined the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) this Friday, replacing Intel (INTC) and Dow Inc. (DOW). Yahoo Finance markets and data editor Jared Blikre joins the Morning Brief to break down the push for more tech representation in the Dow, which historically lacked many tech stocks until companies like Microsoft (MSFT) and Intel joined during the dot-com bubble.

data.title: Why Nvidia is replacing Intel on the Dow Jones

data.title: Nvidia surpasses Apple as world's most valuable company once again
data.text: NVIDIA Corp (NASDAQ:NVDA, ETR:NVD) has finished the trading day as the world's most valuable company, overtaking Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL, ETR:APC) with a market capitalization of $3.43 trillion compared to Apple's $3.38 trillion. This shift reflects Nvidia's soaring stock price, which has nearly tripled in 2024 amid strong demand for its high-performance graphics processing units (GPUs).
